Adder.description:
Add the input signals together. The adder can be used to add signals
together. It must have exactly one output.

Biquad.description:
A single biquad filter stage.

A biquad filter is a second-order recursive filter that can implement various
filter types like lowpass, highpass, bandpass, etc. This stage implements a
single biquad section with slew rate limiting to prevent audio artifacts
when parameters are changed.

BiquadParameters.description:
Parameters for a biquad filter.

Attributes
----------
filter_type : audio_dsp.models.fields.BIQUAD_TYPES
    The parameters of the type of biquad filter to use (e.g., biquad_lowpass, biquad_highpass, etc.)

filter_type.description: Type of biquad filter to implement and it's parameters.

BiquadSlew.description:
A single biquad filter stage.

A biquad filter is a second-order recursive filter that can implement various
filter types like lowpass, highpass, bandpass, etc. This stage implements a
single biquad section with slew rate limiting to prevent audio artifacts
when parameters are changed.

BiquadSlewParameters.description: Parameters for a slewing biquad filter.

filter_type.description: Type of biquad filter to implement and it's parameters.

slew_shift.description: The shift value used in the exponential slew.

Bypass.description:
This stage implements a bypass. The input signal is passed through
unchanged.

CascadedBiquads.description:
8 cascaded biquad filters. This allows up to 8 second order
biquad filters to be run in series.

This can be used for either:

- an Nth order filter built out of cascaded second order sections
- a parametric EQ, where several biquad filters are used at once.

CascadedBiquads16.description:
8 cascaded biquad filters. This allows up to 8 second order
biquad filters to be run in series.

This can be used for either:

- an Nth order filter built out of cascaded second order sections
- a parametric EQ, where several biquad filters are used at once.

CascadedBiquadsParameters.description:
Parameters for CascadedBiquad Stage.

Attributes
----------
filters : list[BIQUAD_TYPES]
    A list of BiquadParameters to update the cascaded biquads with.

Clipper.description: Clipper stage model for limiting signal amplitude.

threshold_db.description: Level in dB above which clipping occurs

ratio.description: Compression ratio applied when detect signal exceeds threshold

threshold_db.description: Level in dB above which compression occurs

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for compressor to start compressing

release_t.description: Time in seconds for signal to return to original level

CompressorRMS.description:
Compressor stage based on RMS envelope of input signal.

When the RMS envelope of the signal exceeds the threshold, the signal
amplitude is reduced by the compression ratio. The threshold sets the value
above which compression occurs. The ratio sets how much the signal is
compressed. A ratio of 1 results in no compression, while a ratio of
infinity results in the same behavior as a limiter.

The attack time sets how fast the compressor starts compressing. The release
time sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

CompressorSidechain.description:
Sidechain compressor stage based on RMS envelope of detect signal.

This stage requires exactly 2 input channels:
1. The signal to be compressed
2. The detect signal that controls the compression

When the RMS envelope of the detect signal exceeds the threshold, the
processed signal amplitude is reduced by the compression ratio. The threshold
sets the value above which compression occurs. The ratio sets how much the
signal is compressed. A ratio of 1 results in no compression, while a ratio
of infinity results in the same behavior as a limiter.

The attack time sets how fast the compressor starts compressing. The release
time sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

ratio.description: Compression ratio applied when detect signal exceeds threshold

threshold_db.description: Level in dB above which compression occurs

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for compressor to start compressing

release_t.description: Time in seconds for signal to return to original level

CompressorSidechainPlacement.description:
Node placement for sidechain compressor.

Requires exactly 2 inputs:
- Input 0: Signal to be compressed
- Input 1: Detect signal used to control compression

Produces exactly 1 output:
- Output 0: Compressed version of input 0

CompressorSidechainStereo.description:
Sidechain compressor stage based on RMS envelope of detect signal.

This stage requires exactly 2 input channels:
1. The signal to be compressed
2. The detect signal that controls the compression

When the RMS envelope of the detect signal exceeds the threshold, the
processed signal amplitude is reduced by the compression ratio. The threshold
sets the value above which compression occurs. The ratio sets how much the
signal is compressed. A ratio of 1 results in no compression, while a ratio
of infinity results in the same behavior as a limiter.

The attack time sets how fast the compressor starts compressing. The release
time sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

mix.description: Set the mix of the crossfader

Delay.description:
Delay stage for delaying input signals.

Delays the input signal by a specified amount. The maximum delay is set at
compile time via config, and the runtime delay can be set between 0 and max_delay.
The delay can be specified in either samples or seconds.

DelayConfig.description:
Configuration for delay stage.

Attributes
----------
    max_delay: Maximum delay length in samples
    units: Units for delay values, either "samples" or "seconds"

delay.description: Current delay length in the configured units

attack_t.description: Attack time of the stage in seconds.

release_t.description: Release time of the stage in seconds.

EnvelopeDetectorPeak.description:
A stage with no outputs that measures the signal peak envelope.

The current envelope of the signal can be read out using this stage's
``envelope`` control.

Attributes
----------
dsp_block : :class:`audio_dsp.dsp.drc.drc.envelope_detector_peak`
    The DSP block class; see :ref:`EnvelopeDetectorPeak`
    for implementation details.

EnvelopeDetectorPlacement.description: Graph placement for an Envelope Stage. This stage has no outputs.

EnvelopeDetectorRMS.description:
A stage with no outputs that measures the signal RMS envelope.

The current envelope of the signal can be read out using this stage's
``envelope`` control.

Attributes
----------
dsp_block : :class:`audio_dsp.dsp.drc.drc.envelope_detector_rms`
    The DSP block class; see :ref:`EnvelopeDetectorRMS`
    for implementation details.

FirConfig.description: Compile time configuration for a FIR Stage.

FirDirect.description: FIR filter stage using direct form implementation.

FixedGain.description:
This stage implements a fixed gain. The input signal is multiplied
by a gain. If the gain is changed at runtime, pops and clicks may
occur.

If the gain needs to be changed at runtime, use a
:class:`VolumeControl` stage instead.

gain_db.description: Gain of the stage in dB.

Fork.description: Forks the input signal into multiple outputs.

ForkConfig.description: Compile time configuration for a Fork Stage.

ForkPlacement.description: Graph placement for a Fork Stage.

Graph.description: Graph object to hold the pipeline information.

frame_size.description: Number of frames per sample for the pipeline. Default is 1 (sample-based).

GraphicEq10b.description:
This stage implements a Graphic EQ with 10 bands.
Each band can be adjusted with a gain value ranging from -24 dB to +24 dB.

GraphicEq10bParameters.description:
Parameters for a 10-band graphic equalizer.

Attributes
----------
    gains_db: (list[float])
        Gain values (in dB) for each of the 10 frequency bands.
        - Each value must be between -24 dB and +24 dB.
        - The list must have exactly 10 elements.

items.description: Gain of the band in dB.

HardLimiterPeak.description:
Hard limiter stage based on peak value of signal.

When the peak envelope of the signal exceeds the threshold, the signal
amplitude is reduced. If the signal still exceeds the threshold, it is
clipped. The peak envelope of the signal may never exceed the threshold.

The threshold sets the value above which limiting/clipping occurs. The
attack time sets how fast the limiter starts limiting. The release time
sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

Input.description: A set of inputs to a DSP graph.

threshold_db.description: Level in dB above which limiting occurs

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for limiter to start limiting

release_t.description: Time in seconds for signal to return to original level

LimiterPeak.description:
Limiter stage based on peak value of signal.

When the peak envelope of the signal exceeds the threshold, the signal
amplitude is reduced. The threshold sets the value above which limiting
occurs.

The attack time sets how fast the limiter starts limiting. The release
time sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

LimiterRMS.description:
Limiter stage based on RMS value of signal.

When the RMS envelope of the signal exceeds the threshold, the signal
amplitude is reduced. The threshold sets the value above which limiting
occurs.

The attack time sets how fast the limiter starts limiting. The release
time sets how long the signal takes to ramp up to its original level after
the envelope is below the threshold.

threshold_db.description: Level in dB above which limiting occurs

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for limiter to start limiting

release_t.description: Time in seconds for signal to return to original level

Mixer.description:
Mixes the input signals together. The mixer can be used to add signals together, or to attenuate the input signals.
It must have exactly one output.

gain_db.description: Gain of the stage in dB.

MonoPlacement.description: The placement of a mono stage that must have 1 input and 1 output.

NodePlacement.description:
The allowed placement of a DSP Stage in the graph.

By default a stage may take any number of inputs.
This may be subclassed for custom placement behaviour.

NoiseGate.description:
Noise gate stage for removing low-level signals.

Attenuates signals that fall below a threshold, useful for removing
background noise during silent passages. When the signal falls below
the threshold, the gain is reduced to 0 over the release time. When
the signal rises above the threshold, the gain is increased to 1 over
the attack time.

threshold_db.description: Level in dB below which the gate begins to close

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for gate to open when signal exceeds threshold

release_t.description: Time in seconds for gate to close when signal falls below threshold

NoiseSuppressorExpander.description:
Noise suppressor expander stage.

A noise suppressor that reduces the level of an audio signal when it falls below a threshold. This is also known as an expander.

When the signal envelope falls below the threshold, the gain applied
to the signal is reduced relative to the expansion ratio over the
release time. When the envelope returns above the threshold, the
gain applied to the signal is increased to 1 over the attack time.

The initial state of the noise suppressor is with the suppression
off; this models a full scale signal having been present before
t = 0.

NoiseSuppressorExpanderParameters.description: Parameters for noise suppressor expander stage.

ratio.description: Expansion ratio applied when signal falls below threshold

threshold_db.description: Level in dB below which expansion occurs

attack_t.description: Time in seconds for expander to start expanding

release_t.description: Time in seconds for signal to return to original level

NthOrderFilter.description:
An Nth order filter implemented as 8 cascaded biquad filters.
This allows up to a 16th order filter to be implemented as a single stage.

type.description: Type of filter to implement. Can be 'bypass', 'highpass', or 'lowpass'.

filter.description: Class of filter to use. Currently only 'butterworth' is supported.

order.description: The order of the filter. Must be even and less than 16.

filter_freq.description: -3dB cutoff frequency of the filter in Hz.

Output.description: A set of outputs from a DSP graph.

input.description: List of input edges as (node_name, index) tuples

ParametricEq16b.description:
16 cascaded biquad filters. This allows up to 16 second order
biquad filters to be run in series as a paramertic EQ.

ParametricEq8b.description:
8 cascaded biquad filters. This allows up to 8 second order
biquad filters to be run in series as a paramertic EQ.

Placement_2i1o.description: The placement of a stage that must have 2 inputs and 1 outputs.

Placement_4i1o.description: The placement of a stage that must have 4 inputs and 1 output.

Placement_4i2o.description: The placement of a stage that must have 2 inputs and 1 outputs.

Placement_Ni1o.description: Graph placement for a Stage that takes many input and one output.

ReverbPlateStereo.description:
The stereo room plate stage. This is based on Dattorro's 1997
paper. This reverb consists of 4 allpass filters for input diffusion,
followed by a figure of 8 reverb tank of allpasses, low-pass filters,
and delays. The output is taken from multiple taps in the delay lines
to get a desirable echo density.

ReverbPlateStereoConfig.description: Compile time configuration for a ReverbPlateStereo Stage.

max_predelay.description: Set the maximum predelay in milliseconds.

pregain.description: It is not advised to increase this value above the default 0.5, as it can result in saturation inside the reverb delay lines.

wet_dry_mix.description: The mix between the wet and dry signal. When the mix is 0, the output signal is fully dry, when 1, the output signal is fully wet.

width.description: How much stereo separation there is between the left and right channels. Setting width to 0 will yield a mono signal, whilst setting width to 1 will yield the most stereo separation.

damping.description: This controls how much high frequency attenuation is in the room. Higher values yield shorter reverberation times at high frequencies. Range: 0 to 1

decay.description: This sets how reverberant the room is. Higher values will give a longer reverberation time for a given room size. Range: 0 to 1

early_diffusion.description: Sets how much diffusion is present in the first part of the reverberation. Range: 0 to 1

late_diffusion.description: Sets how much diffusion is present in the latter part of the reverberation. Range: 0 to 1

bandwidth.description: Sets the low pass cutoff frequency of the reverb input.

ReverbRoomConfig.description: Compile time configuration for a ReverbRoom Stage.

max_predelay.description: Set the maximum predelay in milliseconds.

max_room_size.description: Sets the maximum room size for this reverb. The ``room_size`` parameter sets the fraction of this value actually used at any given time. For optimal memory usage, max_room_size should be set so that the longest reverb tail occurs when ``room_size=1.0``.

pregain.description: It is not advised to increase this value above the default 0.015, as it can result in saturation inside the reverb delay lines.

wet_dry_mix.description: The mix between the wet and dry signal. When the mix is 0, the output signal is fully dry, when 1, the output signal is fully wet.

damping.description: This controls how much high frequency attenuation is in the room. Higher values yield shorter reverberation times at high frequencies. Range: 0 to 1

decay.description: This sets how reverberant the room is. Higher values will give a longer reverberation time for a given room size. Range: 0 to 1

room_size.description: This sets how reverberant the room is. Higher values will give a longer reverberation time for a given room size. Range: 0 to 1

ReverbRoomStereoConfig.description: Compile time configuration for a ReverbRoomStereo Stage.

max_predelay.description: Set the maximum predelay in milliseconds.

max_room_size.description: Sets the maximum room size for this reverb. The ``room_size`` parameter sets the fraction of this value actually used at any given time. For optimal memory usage, max_room_size should be set so that the longest reverb tail occurs when ``room_size=1.0``.

pregain.description: It is not advised to increase this value above the default 0.015, as it can result in saturation inside the reverb delay lines.

wet_dry_mix.description: The mix between the wet and dry signal. When the mix is 0, the output signal is fully dry, when 1, the output signal is fully wet.

damping.description: This controls how much high frequency attenuation is in the room. Higher values yield shorter reverberation times at high frequencies. Range: 0 to 1

decay.description: This sets how reverberant the room is. Higher values will give a longer reverberation time for a given room size. Range: 0 to 1

room_size.description: This sets how reverberant the room is. Higher values will give a longer reverberation time for a given room size. Range: 0 to 1

width.description: How much stereo separation there is between the left and right channels. Setting width to 0 will yield a mono signal, whilst setting width to 1 will yield the most stereo separation.

Router4to1.description:
A 4:1 Router that combines functionality of both switch and mixer.
It takes exactly 4 inputs and can select any combination of them
to be mixed to a single output.

Router4to1Parameters.description:
Parameters for 4:1 router stage.

Attributes
----------
    channel_states: [bool, bool, bool, bool]
        List of 4 boolean values indicating which channels are active.

StereoPlacement.description: The placement of a stereo stage that must have 2 inputs and 2 outputs.

Subtractor.description:
Subtract the input signals. The subtractor can be used to subtract
signals together. It must have exactly one output.

Switch.description:
Switch the input to one of the outputs. The switch can be used to
select between different signals.

position.description: Switch position. This changes the output signal to the input[index]

SwitchSlew.description:
Switch the input to one of the outputs with slew. The switch can be used to
select between different signals.

SwitchStereo.description:
Switch the input to one of the stereo pairs of outputs. The switch
can be used to select between different stereo signal pairs. The
inputs should be passed in pairs, e.g. ``[0_L, 0_R, 1_L, 1_R, ...]``.
Setting the switch position will output the nth pair.

VolumeControl.description:
This stage implements a volume control. The input signal is
multiplied by a gain. The gain can be changed at runtime. To avoid
pops and clicks during gain changes, a slew is applied to the gain
update. The stage can be muted and unmuted at runtime.

gain_db.description: Gain of the stage in dB.

mute_state.description: The mute state of the VolumeControl: 0: unmuted, 1: muted.

biquad_allpass.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to allpass.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

biquad_bandpass.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to bandpass.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

bw.description: Bandwidth of the filter in octaves.

biquad_bandstop.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to bandstop.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

bw.description: Bandwidth of the filter in octaves.

biquad_bypass.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to bypass.

biquad_constant_q.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to constant_q.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

boost_db.description: Gain of the filter in dB.

biquad_gain.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to gain.

gain_db.description: Gain of the stage in dB.

biquad_highpass.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to highpass.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

biquad_highshelf.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to highshelf.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

boost_db.description: Gain of the filter in dB.

biquad_linkwitz.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to linkwitz.

f0.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

fp.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

biquad_lowpass.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to lowpass.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

biquad_lowshelf.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to lowshelf.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

boost_db.description: Gain of the filter in dB.

biquad_mute.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to mute.

biquad_notch.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to notch.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

biquad_peaking.description: Parameters for a Biquad Stage configured to peaking.

filter_freq.description: Frequency of the filter in Hz.

boost_db.description: Gain of the filter in dB.

description: A complete description of the schema of a DSP graph.
title: DspJson
